page.title: 11STEPPINGLEY, NEAR FLITWICK.
page.content: STEPPINGLEY IS A SMALL VILLAGE ABOUT ONE MILE FROM FLITWICK, WITH A POPULATION OF ABOUT 150. THE ROAD WINDS THROUGH THE VILLAGE WITH HIGH BANKS ON EITHER SIDE. IN THE CENTRE IS THE CHURCH OF ST. LAWRENCE, BUILT BY THE DUKE OF BEDFORD ABOUT 100 YEARS AGO, AS WAS THE SCHOOL WHICH IS NOW A PRIVATE RESIDENCE. THE POST OFFICE, OPPOSITE THE CHURCH, IS RUN FROM ONE ROOM OF A QUAINT THATCHED COTTAGE. NEXT TO THE CHURCH IS 'THE FRENCH HORN', A RESTAURANT AND PUBLIC HOUSE. ON THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF THE VILLAGE IS PEAKES END, WHERE THERE IS A LARGE THATCHED COTTAGE CALLED 'THE CROFT'. THIS STANDS BY ITSELF FACING A SMALL GREEN, WHERE VILLAGE FUNCTIONS ARE HELD. THERE IS ALSO A DISUSED WESLEYAN METHODIST CHAPEL, WHICH HAS BEEN CONVERTED INTO A PRIVATE HOUSE.
